title: Japanese serow
summary: The Japanese serow (氈鹿, lit. "coarse pelt deer"): (Capricornis crispus)[lower-alpha 1]  (羚羊) is a Japanese goat-antelope, an even-toed ungulate mammal. It is found in dense woodland in Japan, primarily in northern and central Honshu. The animal is seen as a national symbol of Japan, and is subject to protection in conservation areas.
